definition: to overreach oneself/to try to be clever and end up with egg on one's face
lane/alley
to do/to manage/to handle/to play with/to fool with/to mess with/to fix/to toy with
opportunely/coincidentally/as it happens/skillful/timely
surname Cheng
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
awkward/clumsy/dull/inelegant/(polite) my/Taiwan pr. [zhuo2]

sentences.english: Elder brother big move has intellective drawback, often outsmart oneself.
sentences.chinese: 哥哥大招有智力缺陷，往往弄巧成拙。

sentences.english: As we soon discovered, though, most people can't carry it off.
sentences.chinese: 不過，我們很快發現，其實大部分人都弄巧成拙。

sentences.english: Do not prepared to change without objects and divergent, and thus self-defeating.
sentences.chinese: 千萬不要毫無對象和準備地求變求異，從而弄巧成拙。

sentences.english: Perceiving myself in a blunder, I attempted to correct it.
sentences.chinese: 認識到自己弄巧成拙，我就試着去糾正錯誤。

definition: to produce the opposite of the desired result
see 弄巧成拙[nong4 qiao3 cheng2 zhuo1]
lit. to try to steal a chicken only to end up losing the rice used to lure it (idiom)/fig. to try to gain an advantage only to end up worse off/to go for wool and come back shorn
pinyin: tou1 ji1 bu4 cheng2 shi2 ba3 mi3

definition: to try to draw a tiger but end up with a likeness of a dog (idiom)/to try to do sth overambitious and end up botching it
pinyin: hua4 hu3 bu4 cheng2 fan3 lei4 quan3

definition: the gains do not make up for the losses (idiom)
to invite trouble
lit. draw legs on a snake (idiom); fig. to ruin the effect by adding sth superfluous/to overdo it
see 偷雞不成蝕把米|偷鸡不成蚀把米[tou1 ji1 bu4 cheng2 shi2 ba3 mi3]
pinyin: tou1 ji1 bu4 zhao2 shi2 ba3 mi3

definition: stir up the fire and you get burnt (idiom); to get one's fingers burnt/fig. to suffer on account of one's own meddling
pretense that turns into reality (idiom); to play at make-believe, but accidentally make it true
to hand someone the swordhilt (idiom)/to give someone a hold on oneself
to think oneself clever (idiom)
a clever person may become the victim of his own ingenuity (idiom); cleverness may overreach itself/too smart for one's own good
pinyin: cong1 ming2 fan3 bei4 cong1 ming2 wu4

definition: to make a fool of oneself/to make oneself a laughing stock
a new branch grows out of a knot (idiom); fig. side issues keep arising
having given away a bride, to lose one's army on top of it (idiom)/to suffer a double loss after trying to trick the enemy
pinyin: pei2 le5 fu1 ren2 you4 zhe2 bing1
